pullRequest.body:
For disjoint `s t : Set α`, there is a natural injection from `↑s ⊕ ↑t` to `α`. We provide this as an embedding, and do the same for an indexed family of pairwise disjoint sets. 

---

maintainer merge

```suggestion
```

This could equivalently be written as
```suggestion
@[simps] def Disjoint.sumSubtypeEmbedding (h : Disjoint s t) : s ⊕ t ↪ α :=
  (Equiv.Set.union h).toEmbedding.trans (.subtype _)
```
(except for the fact that `Equiv.Set.union` takes in `s ∩ t ⊆ ∅` rather than `Disjoint s t`, which should be fixed), so maybe not worth a separate definition?
This has the advantage of not needing decidability. Also, the simp lemmas below would look quite clunky without a definition.

> the simp lemmas below would look quite clunky without a definition

That's usually not a concern since there are simp lemmas dealing with the intermediate expression




> This has the advantage of not needing decidability

That is a fair point
Please show the equality with my spelling, though
Same here with [Set.unionEqSigmaOfDisjoint](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Lattice.html#Set.unionEqSigmaOfDisjoint)
Same response as above, except this time noncomputability.
Same here

```suggestion
    rintro ⟨i, x, hx⟩ ⟨j, -, hx'⟩ rfl
```
What does `simps` generate? I think you're missing `@[norm_cast] lemma Disjoint.coe_sumSubtypeEmbedding`

```suggestion
@[simps] def Function.Embedding.sumSet (h : Disjoint s t) : s ⊕ t ↪ α where
```
seems more in line with the existing `Equiv.Set.union`

And this could be
```suggestion
@[simps] def Function.Embedding.sigmaSet {s : ι → Set α} (h : Pairwise (Disjoint on s)) :
```

Those brackets everywhere are unnecessary
```suggestion
    .inr ⁻¹' Function.Embedding.sumSet h ⁻¹' r = r ∩ t := by
```
Doesn't work.
Uh, we should fix that. Pretty sure it worked in Lean 4. But okay for now

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Logic/Embedding/Set): Injections from subtypes of disjoint sets
